data.title: Study in Portugal for International Students: Complete Details!
data.meta_description: Planning to study in Portugal? Explore top universities and courses here. Discover MBBS and PhD programs, including options without IELTS.
data.text:
21 min read

Ever feel stuck in a college rut, yearning for an adventure that fuels your education? Imagine strolling along cobblestone streets in Lisbon, soaking up the sun on Algarve beaches, all while earning a degree that sets you apart. Applying to top universities to study in Portugal can make this dream come true.

Did you know that Portugal offers a unique opportunity for a high-quality education at a reasonable cost, with its affordable tuition fees, often under INR 1.3L (EUR 1.5k) per year at public universities, and a low cost of living for international students?

To study in Portugal for Indian students isn’t just a pipe dream – it’s an achievable reality that can transform your academic journey.

Prepare to ditch the ordinary and begin an extraordinary educational adventure in Portugal!

Key Highlights

Ready to explore why you should study in Portugal? Here’s a table tailored just for you. It provides a detailed snapshot view of everything you will read at length in the blog post.

Why Study in Portugal?

Did you know that 17% of the total enrollment of students who study in Portugal are international students? This impressive statistic highlights Portugal’s growing popularity as a top study destination.

Here are some noteworthy reasons why you should study in this country. Have a look.

Affordable Tuition Fees: Portugal offers some of Europe’s most affordable tuition fees. You can pursue high-quality education without breaking the bank, with many programs such as business administration, computer science and others costing under INR 1.3L (EUR 1.5k) per year.

Low Cost of Living: The cost of living for Indian students in Portugal is relatively low compared to other Western European countries. Monthly expenses, excluding rent, range from INR 22k to INR 45k (250 to 500 EUR), making it easier for students to manage their finances.

Here’s a quick cost comparison for you.

High-Quality Education: Portugal is home to some of the world’s oldest and most prestigious universities, such as the University of Lisbon, the University of Porto, and the University of Coimbra. These institutions offer a wide range of programs taught by experienced faculty members.

Diverse Course Options: Whether it’s an MBBS in Portugal for Indian students or a PhD in Portugal, the country has a program for you.

Rich Cultural Experience: Studying in Portugal is about more than just academics. It’s also about experiencing the spirited culture with events like Carnaval and the Santo António Festival. You’ll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in Portuguese history and traditions.

English-Taught Programs: Many universities in Portugal offer programs taught in English, making it easier for international students like you to adapt and succeed academically.

Scholarships and Financial Aid: Numerous scholarships are available for Indian students, including the Portuguese Government Scholarships, Erasmus Mundus Program, and others. These can reduce the cost of study in Portugal significantly.

Post-Study Work Visas: Portugal provides post-study work visas that allow international graduates to stay and work in the country for up to one year after completing their studies. This gives you the chance to gain professional experience and establish your career. For example, in the tech industry, entry-level software engineers can earn between INR 22L to INR 31L (EUR 25k to 35k) per year.

Safe and Welcoming Environment: Portugal is known for its friendly and welcoming people. The country is ranked as the 16th safest country in Europe, with a Safety Index of 68.8. Needless to say, if you are a female student from India and worried about your safety in a land far away from your home country, it is very safe for you to study in Portugal.

Top 5 Universities to Study in Portugal

Portugal might be a relatively small country, but its educational offerings pack a punch! With over 100 universities and colleges to study in Portugal, you’re guaranteed to find the perfect fit for your academic aspirations.

Lisbon and Porto, Portugal’s dynamic hubs, boast the highest concentration of these institutions. Imagine yourself immersed in the rich culture of these cities, exploring historic landmarks by day and hitting the books in a world-class university by night.

But Portugal’s charm extends far beyond these metropolises — get ready to discover a network of esteemed universities waiting to find your potential, all while soaking up the unique atmosphere of each vibrant city.

Buckle up because you’re about to get into the top five universities to study in Portugal for Indian students!

Here’s a glimpse at the top 5 universities to study in Portugal, based on their QS World Ranking 2025.

Get into the world of these top universities to study in Portugal for international students and their entry requirements.

University of Lisbon (ULisboa)

The University of Lisbon (ULisboa),established in 1288, could be your dream come true. Founded in the 13th century, ULisboa is steeped in tradition and a powerhouse of modern education. It currently has 6,394 international students.

Notable Alumni:

António Guterres: Former Prime Minister of Portugal and current Secretary-General of the United Nations, recognised for his work in international diplomacy and humanitarian efforts.

José Saramago: Nobel Prize-winning author known for his profound and influential literary works, including “Blindness” and “The Year of the Death of Ricardo Reis.”

But before you can plan to study in Portugal at this university, understand its admission criteria listed below.

University of Porto (U.Porto)

Channel your inner explorer and get ready to set sail on an academic voyage at the University of Porto (U.Porto)! This prestigious institution, established in 1911, is nestled in the heart of the captivating city of Porto, isn’t just about lectures and exams. It’s a gateway to a world of discovery.

Approximately 13% of U.Porto’s students are international, representing over 100 nationalities. You’ll have the chance to learn from diverse perspectives and make friendships and memories that will last a lifetime.

Notable Alumni:

Manuel Sobrinho Simões: A leading pathologist and researcher recognised as one of the most influential scientists in the field of cancer research.

Elvira Fortunato: Renowned physicist and materials scientist celebrated for her pioneering work in developing paper and transparent electronics.

So, why not follow in the footsteps of these remarkable alumni?

Here are the admission requirements for the University of Porto.

University of Coimbra

Picture yourself strolling through the hallowed halls of the University of Coimbra, Portugal’s oldest (established in 1290!), located in the historic city, a UNESCO World Heritage site. This isn’t just any university; it’s a timeless journey through knowledge steeped in tradition and architectural grandeur.

In fact, the University of Coimbra boasts 2,949 international students, making up 13.4% of its total enrollment!

But UC isn’t just about dusty tomes. It’s a thriving innovation hub, offering a diverse range of courses with alumni like:

António Egas Moniz: Neurologist and Nobel Prize winner in Physiology or Medicine, recognised for his groundbreaking work in developing cerebral angiography and prefrontal lobotomy.

Mariano Gago: Former Minister of Science, Technology, and Higher Education in Portugal, known for his significant contributions to advancing science and technology policies in the country.

Time to get into the entry requirements. Have a look at the details tabulated below.

University of Aveiro

Imagine brainstorming with professors at the forefront of their fields while catching glimpses of the sparkling Atlantic Ocean between classes. Established in 1973, the University of Aveiro (UA) is a prestigious public university known for its strong emphasis on research and innovation.

The university hosts students from 90 nationalities, fostering a diverse and multicultural academic environment.

Notable Alumni:

Maria Silva – Master’s in Environmental Engineering; Senior Environmental Consultant at GreenTech Solutions, Portugal; led research on sustainable water management.

João Pereira – Bachelor’s in Computer Science; Chief Technology Officer (CTO) at SecureNet; developed AI-driven cybersecurity software.

Here are the details you need to get started if you want to join the enchanting university.

Universidade Nova de Lisboa

Forget the dusty image of academia — NOVA is a vibrant constellation of nine academic units, more than 22,000 students, 2,500 teachers and researchers, and more than 3,400 international students of 110 nationalities, each a powerhouse in its own right.

Founded in 1973, it’s a young university with a fiercely forward-thinking spirit, making it the perfect launchpad for students who crave a dynamic and modern education.

Universidade Nova de Lisboa boasts a remarkable network of alumni, including a few prominent names listed below:

Elvira Fortunato – A professor, physicist, engineer, and current Minister of Science, Technology, and Higher Education in Portugal. She is renowned for her groundbreaking work in the field of transparent electronics.

António Câmara —A professor and entrepreneur known for his contributions to environmental engineering and his role in founding several successful technology companies.

Do you aspire to follow in the footsteps of these notable alumni? Then, get down to the nitty-gritty details you need to start your journey at this university.

Top 3 Universities to Study in Portugal Without IELTS

Dreaming of studying abroad but dreading the IELTS? Portugal says “adeus” (goodbye) to that stress! There is a way to study in Portugal without IELTS, minus the test anxiety.

Some universities in Portugal, such as the University of Coimbra, accept students without requiring IELTS scores. They offer 100% tuition fee waivers for certain programs, including various bachelor’s and master’s degrees in fields like science and technology, humanities, and social sciences. ​

Get ready to explore the top 3 universities in Portugal that welcome international students with open arms, no IELTS required:

Top 5 Courses to Study in Portugal

Portugal isn’t just about stunning beaches and delicious food (although those are great perks!). It’s also a launchpad for a successful career. Major multinational companies like Siemens, Bosch, Volkswagen, and Ikea have established R&D and innovation centres in Portugal, attracted by the country’s skilled workforce.

So, what are the hottest courses that will put you at the forefront of this dynamic job market?

Here’s a table outlining the top universities to study in Portugal for various courses.

Medicine

Ever dreamt of wielding a stethoscope on sun-drenched shores? Studying MBBS in Portugal for Indian students can turn that dream into reality! Portugal offers a world-class medical education, renowned for its rigour and respect across Europe.

Over 90% of medical graduates from top Portuguese universities are employed within six months of completing their degree.

Engineering

Need help memorising formulas in a stuffy classroom? Portugal offers an engineering education that’s as dynamic as you are! Forget textbook struggle – you’ll be shoulder-to-shoulder with professors on cutting-edge projects, tackling real-world challenges from the get-go.

The estimated total pay for an Engineer in the Lisbon, Portugal area is INR 1.35L per month (EUR 1.5k). This makes Portugal an attractive destination for aspiring engineers.

Business and Management

The revenue of business and other management consultancy activities in Portugal will reach approximately EUR 4,296.32M by 2025. Portugal, with this growing economy, presents a unique and exciting environment for business and management professionals.

Tourism and Hospitality

Tourism revenue in Portugal reached around INR 2.2 billion (EUR 25 billion) in 2023, an increase of 18.5% compared to the previous year. The surge in tourism highlights Portugal’s growing appeal as a top travel destination known for its rich history, stunning landscapes, and world-renowned hospitality.

As the tourism sector booms, so does the demand for well-trained professionals in tourism and hospitality management.

Arts and Design

In 2023, Portugal’s vibrant culture and creative industries drew global attention to its arts and design education. Renowned for its artistic heritage, Portugal offers esteemed programs for aspiring artists and designers in top universities.

The Faculdade de Belas-Artes da Universidade de Lisboa, the oldest art school in Portugal, hosts over 100 international students from 26 countries and welcomes around 70 study-abroad students annually.

To support the growing interest in arts and design, several universities in Portugal offer comprehensive courses across various disciplines.

Intakes at Top Universities in Portugal

So you’ve set your sights on studying in Portugal – fantastic choice! But before diving headfirst into applications, understanding the intake system is critical. Unlike some countries with a single intake, Portugal offers flexibility with three application rounds yearly. Take a closer look:

Portugal’s Intake System

Portuguese universities operate on a two-semester system, with courses starting in either the Fall (September) or Spring (February) semester. These application rounds cater to both starting points:

Round 1 (April-May): This is the earliest and often the most competitive round. If you want to start in the fall semester, aim to submit your application well before the deadline.

Round 2 (June-July): This is the second-chance round for Fall semester applicants or the primary round for those aiming for a Spring semester start.

Round 3 (August-September): This is the final round, with potentially fewer program options. Consider it a backup option or ideal for those who have made a last-minute decision to study in Portugal.

Tips for Applying Based on Intakes

Getting through the application process for universities can seem exhausting, especially with varying intake periods and deadlines.

Here are some essential tips to help you streamline your application and increase your chances of securing a spot in your desired program:

Early Bird Gets the Worm: To increase your chances of securing a spot, submit your application well before the deadline, especially for the primary intake.

Check Individual Programs: While the general intake periods are as mentioned above, some universities or specific programs might have slight variations. Always double-check the official website of your chosen university and program for their particular deadlines.

Be Flexible: If your dream program isn’t available during the secondary intake, consider applying for a different program or waiting for the following primary intake.

Cost of Living in Portugal for Indian Students

Living the dream of studying abroad shouldn’t break the bank! Portugal offers a fantastic alternative, boasting a significantly lower cost of living than many other European destinations, such as the United Kingdom, France, Germany, and the Netherlands.

For instance, while a gym membership in these countries can range from INR 4,500 to 9,000 (EUR 50 to 100) per month, in Portugal, you can find a membership for as low as INR 2,700 (EUR 30). This makes staying fit and healthy much more affordable for students!

Scholarships to Reduce the Cost of Study in Portugal

Feeling the pinch of potential study costs in Portugal? Relaxa (relax)! You will find a variety of scholarships to study in Portugal for international students, making your academic journey more accessible.

Did you know 146 Indian students were awarded Erasmus Mundus scholarships in Europe in 2024? This benefit is worth up to INR 19k (EUR 221) and can reach INR 24.5k (EUR 289) in areas with higher rents.

Here’s your key to acquiring some financial lifesavers to study in Portugal.

Application Process for a Visa to Study in Portugal

With an annual growth rate of 10%, the number of students studying abroad continues to rise globally. Due to demographic shifts, there will probably be 8 million overseas students by 2025. If you’re considering joining this trend and aiming to study in Portugal, securing a student visa is a crucial step.

Securing a student visa is essential to realise your dream of studying in Portugal. The INR 8.1k fee is equivalent to EUR 90 at the current exchange rate.

Here are the documents you need to gather before starting your application:

Ensure your passport has at least six months remaining validity from your intended entry into Portugal.

Get an acceptance letter from your chosen Portuguese university confirming your enrollment in a recognised study program.

Demonstrate your ability to financially support yourself during your studies with bank statements, scholarship documentation, or a sponsor’s letter of support.

A recent medical certificate issued by a certified medical professional is required. Estimated cost: INR 1.5k to 3k (EUR 18 to 36).

Secure health insurance coverage valid for the duration of your stay in Portugal. Estimated cost: INR 4.5.k to 9k (EUR 54 to 108) per year.

A criminal background check document issued by your home country authorities.

Download and complete the official Portuguese visa application form accurately and legibly.

2 recent passport-sized photographs meet the specified requirements.

Process for Applying for a Portuguese Student Visa

Follow these steps to navigate the Portuguese student visa application process smoothly:

Submit Your Application. You can do this in the following 2 ways.

In Person: Visit your home country’s Portuguese embassy or consulate and submit your application package and the required fee. This may take 2-3 weeks.

Online Application System (if available): Some countries may offer an online visa application system. Check with your country’s Portuguese embassy or consulate for details and eligibility.

Attend Your Visa Interview (if required). Finalise your study plans in Portugal smoothly.

The embassy or consulate might request an in-person interview as part of the application process.

Be prepared to answer questions about your studies, living arrangements, and financial plans in Portugal. This process may take an additional 1-2 weeks.

Await the Decision. Each step brings you closer to your educational journey in Portugal.

Processing times for student visas can vary depending on the workload of the embassy or consulate. Typically, a decision can take anywhere from 4 to 8 weeks.

Be patient and allow ample time for your application to be reviewed. Once a decision is made, the embassy or consulate will notify you.

Top High-paying Jobs You Can Get After Completing Your Study in Portugal

Portugal’s average gross monthly salary is around INR 1.08L to INR 1.7L (EUR 1.2k to 1.8k) as of 2024! The country boasts a dynamic job market with opportunities for high earners across various sectors.

To Conclude

So, you’ve battled textbooks, aced exams, and maybe even perfected your pastel de nata recipe. Now what? Portugal beckons! Whether you seek the thrill of a PhD in Portugal or a degree, your journey to study in Portugal opens up a world of opportunities.

So, ditch the fear of the unknown and grab your metaphorical backpack (or suitcase, no judgment here). This isn’t just studying abroad; it’s an adventure waiting to happen.

This guide is here to help you navigate the application process, university options, and excellent courses. Consider it your Portuguese travel brochure, minus the cheesy stock photos. So get packing!
